hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix.immutable

Class ImmutableSubmatrixViewAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix.backbone.AbstractSubmatrixAccessor
      • hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix.immutable.ImmutableSubmatrixViewAccessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SubmatrixAccessor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImmutableSubmatrixViewAccessor2, ImmutableSubmatrixViewAccessor3

    public class ImmutableSubmatrixViewAccessor
extends AbstractSubmatrixAccessor
    Provides access to submatrix views of immutable matrices. The views themselves are also immutable.
    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix.backbone.AbstractSubmatrixAccessor

    • Method Detail

      • matrix

        public ImmutableMatrix matrix(int row,
                     int col,
                     int rowCount,
                     int colCount)
        Description copied from interface: SubmatrixAccessor
        Returns a submatrix. Note that unlike Matrix.getSubmatrix, this function expects the dimensions of the submatrix.
        Parameters:
        row - the first row of the submatrix
        col - the first column of the submatrix
        rowCount - the number of rows in the submatrix
        colCount - the number of columns in the submatrix
        Returns:
        the specified submatrix

      • rowVector

        public ImmutableVector rowVector(int row,
                        int col,
                        int dimension)
        Description copied from interface: SubmatrixAccessor
        Returns a row subvector. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row, col+dimension-1), but returns them as a column vector.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the subvector
        col - the first column containing the subvector
        dimension - the dimension of the subvector
        Returns:
        the specified subvector

      • matrix2

        public ImmutableMatrix2 matrix2(int row,
                       int col)
        Description copied from interface: SubmatrixAccessor
        Returns a 2x2 submatrix. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row+1, col+1).
        Specified by:
        matrix2 in interface SubmatrixAccessor
        Overrides:
        matrix2 in class AbstractSubmatrixAccessor
        Parameters:
        row - the first row of the submatrix
        col - the first column of the submatrix
        Returns:
        the specified submatrix

      • column

        public ImmutableVector column(int col)
        Description copied from interface: SubmatrixAccessor
        Returns an entire column. This function selects the elements between (0, col) and (r-1, col) where r is the number of rows in this matrix.
        Specified by:
        column in interface SubmatrixAccessor
        Overrides:
        column in class AbstractSubmatrixAccessor
        Parameters:
        col - the index of the column
        Returns:
        IllegalArgumentException if col is not a valid column index

      • row

        public ImmutableVector row(int row)
        Description copied from interface: SubmatrixAccessor
        Returns an entire row. This function selects the elements between (row, 0) and (row, c-1) where c is the number of columns in this matrix, but returns these elements as a column vector.
        Specified by:
        row in interface SubmatrixAccessor
        Overrides:
        row in class AbstractSubmatrixAccessor
        Parameters:
        row - the index of the row
        Returns:
        IllegalArgumentException if row is not a valid row index
